body_html: You can write a variant of the LSTMCell that returns both state tensors as part of the output, if you need both c and h state for each time step. If you just need the h state, that's the output of reach time step.
body_text: You can write a variant of the LSTMCell that returns both state tensors as part of the output, if you need both c and h state for each time step.  If you just need the h state, that's the output of reach time step.
body: You can write a variant of the LSTMCell that returns both state tensors as part of the output, if you need both c and h state for each time step.  If you just need the h state, that's the output of reach time step.
